inn1.comm: back of a length, coming into him and he gets behind it to defend with a straight bat
back of a length, nice pace and carry, moves away from him a bit but well outside off, so left alone
goes too far outside off that time and it will be a wide. Sticking to his back of a length area
pitches it on a good length and moving away, the batsman shoulders arms again
goes closer to the batsman now, on a fourth stump line, but still back of a length and the batsman defends from the crease
good length in the channel outside off and he lets this go through
nicely punched through point, back of a length but closer to off stump and he pushes it with good timing to pick up the first runs off the bat
Back of a length outside off, guided to third man
back of a length, gets him to have a poke at it outside off but it whistles past the outside edge
fuller length outside off, driven to point
good length outside off, he gets behind it and steers to point
short arm pull over midwicket. Superbly executed, picked up the length early, transferred weight back and smacked it over the boundary
fuller and straighter, gets behind it and defends it back to the bowler
back of a length, tucks him up on the body and is patted down towards short leg
flicked off his pads to the square leg boundary. Got the length wrong, not short enough and on the pads, which allowed him to pick it off for runs
better line and length, angling across and in the corridor, back of a length. The batsman lets it go
good length on leg stump, he tries to flick it but it takes the pad to roll to short fine leg
tailing on the pad on a good length, but Fernando is happy to get behind it and defend it back to the bowler with a straight bat
good length outside off and he's happy to let it go through
angling across him on a length and he lets it go outside off
good length on off stump, pushed to the bowler's right
outside edge flies past the slips. Back of a length and moving across him, he wants to punch it but gets a thick outside edge that goes past second slip
fuller this time on the stumps and he gets behind the ball to pat it back to the bowler
good length, on off, defended from the crease
super shot. Wasn't that short but he went back in his crease and short-arm pulled it to midwicket's right
back of a length and well outside off, he reaches out and guides this past the slips to third man
good length, angling across and ends up on off, not giving him room. Punched to cover
back of a length and on the fourth stump, rising up to chest height, he plays it down towards the bowler from his crease
fuller on the pads and clipped nicely but can't get past midwicket
that's gone under his bat off an attempted pull. A bit on the shorter side but didn't rise as much, and Karunaratne went to pull it, but the ball goes to the keeper under his bat
fuller length he shuffles across to clip it, but midwicket intercepts
misses the pull. But it'sa no-ball because he over-stepped. Dug it in short and put some more pace on it, flies past the batsman at head height
can't take advantage of the free hit. Slower ball and fuller, he is early into his shot and flicks it uppishly to mid-on, who takes it on the bounce
good length coming into him and ends up on the pads, tucked off his hips to fine leg
lovely shot. Stands up and punches it through cover. A bit too short and some room outside off, he didn't even move his feet, just lashed it with great timing
fuller on the stumps, on-driven but mid-on is able to go to his left and field the ball
length ball on off, defended to cover
a bit fuller and straighter, and he walks across to flick it to fine leg
good length outside off, nice carry and he lets it go through
fuller outside off, he goes on the front foot to drive, opening the face of the bat. Crisply hit and the fielder at cover can't collect cleanly
dropped by first slip!. Dolly of a chance that should have been taken. Good length and moving across him, he has a poke at it, gets a thick edge. Comfortable catching height, but it goes in and out
good tight line outside off and a good hard back of length ball. He's happy to let it go
too far down legside and he'll have to rebowl that
back of a length on the stumps, he goes back and punches this midwicket
digs it in short and beats him on the pull again. Karunaratne wanted to smash that, but ends up connecting with only air
nicely punched between cover and point. Stayed legside of the ball and got into a good, balanced position
good length outside off, he shuffles across and clips it off his pads to midwicket's right
good length on the stumps, he tucks it off his hips to fine leg
too short and sails over his head so that will be a wide
short one again outside off that time and going at chest height. He was looking to pull it down but misses
follows the short ones with a fuller ball on off which is tentatively pushed towards mid-off. Softly enough to get a quick single
fuller on the stumps, he's going across his stumps to those, drives it off his toes to mid-on
good length on the pads, tucked to square leg
edged again, but on the bounce to second slip. Good probing line and length, going across him a tad and on off stump, he comes forward to push it but it only takes the edge
sharp bowling. Hard length on middle and comes in, hits him high on the thigh pad and rolls away on the offside
gets his line wrong that time, good length moving in but ends up on the pads and he's swung it down to fine leg, where the fielder runs quickly to his right, dives, and stops the boundary

another dropped chance. This was also not too difficult. Full ball on off, and no foot movement from the batsman in driving it uppishly. Mid-off is there and gets both hands to it, but it bursts through.
Good length outside off, and he lets it go through
inside edge goes to short fine leg. They're living a charmed life, the Sri Lankan openers. Back of a length outside off, he pushed at it, got the inside edge and it rolled past the stumps
good length on the stumps, he moves across to work it past square leg
dug this in too short and it goes over his head, so he'll have to rebowl that
pulled this over square leg. Short ball that was outside off, but he moved across and got into position nicely to pull this from near his head
good length outside off, pushed to point
loud appeal to a full ball tailing into him. he was moving across though and it takes his pad to go to short fine. That might have been going down leg, so good call
fuller on the stumps, clipped to midwicket

lovely delivery, back of a length in the corridor with a bit of late outswing. No footwork from Fernando, just stands there and jabs at it, looking to play it towards point, and it's quickly past his outside edge
shortish, angling down leg. Looks to flick, only manages a bit of thigh pad on it down to long leg
back of a length on the legs, tucked away to long leg
full, swings from middle to off, nice use of the wrists to clip it to mid-on
back of a length, angling into middle stump, gets nicely behind it to work it through backward square leg
short, wide, and that's nicely put away, stands tall and punches it away to the left of cover point
length ball angling away from off stump, leans forward for a push into the covers
back of a length on off stump, worked away to deep square leg
length ball close to off stump, gets on the front foot to defend into the cover point region
this man is such a good puller. This isn't particularly short on off stump, but he picks the length so quickly to put it away over midwicket
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and opens his bat face to guide it to backward point
back of a length on off stump, and he clears his front leg and punches it away to the right of the diving midwicket fielder
full on middle stump, clipped away through square leg
outswinger, on the fuller side of a good length on a sixth-stump line, left alone

not timed there. Length ball swinging away from off stump, and he looks to stand tall and flat-bat it back over the bowler's head - shades of Robin Uthappa there - but he doesn't really middle it and doesn't get the distance he desires. Mid-on runs to his right and cuts it off
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
length ball straightening late towards off stump. Does well to show the full face to that and block it back to the bowler
another outswinger, shorter this time. Fernando pushes at it without moving his feet a great deal and is beaten
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended to midwicket
a touch shorter on off stump, can't make enough room for the cut, chops it to backward point
full now, on off stump again, blocked back to the bowler
full on leg stump, clipped away to the left of long-on
length ball outside off, punched to the left of short extra
back of a length, turning in towards middle stump, punched with a straight bat towards deep square leg
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, makes room and opens his bat face to stab towards backward point
full, angling into leg stump, clipped to the left of deep midwicket
tossed up, angling in towards leg stump again, clipped round to deep backward square leg
flat length ball on off stump, gets on the front foot to push towards long-off
nice length on off stump, clipped with the turn to long-on
length ball close to off stump, shows the full face to punch towards long-off, past the left hand of the diving bowler
flat length ball on off stump, nice use of the wrists to work it to the right of straight midwicket
full, angling in towards middle and leg, pushed down the ground to the right of mid-on
length ball turning in towards off stump, gets forward and clips it round to square leg
tossed up outside off, gets a stride forward to drive to long-off
tossed up full outside off, driven to long-off
short, wide, cut away to deep point
length ball on off stump, stays back to punch to short extra-cover
a touch shorter, looks for the punch to long-off but short extra moves quickly to intercept once more
fuller and slower on off stump, gets forward to block to the bowler
flatter, angling into the stumps, punched off the back foot to midwicket
flat length ball angling into middle and off, looks to punch to long-off and the bowler dives left to half-stop it and deflect towards short extra-cover
back of a length close to off stump, makes a bit of room to punch to deep point and bring up his fifty
length ball on off stump, nice use of the wrists to clip it down to long-on
full, angling in towards leg stump, clipped to the left of mid-on
back of a length turning in from outside off, punched down to long-on. May have stopped on him, so he's forced to drop his bottom hand and meet the ball well in front of his body
flat and full, angling into the stumps, driven firmly back to the bowler
slower now, outside off, Karunaratne looks to reverse-sweep and doesn't meet it cleanly, ends up nutmegging the keeper
flat length ball angling into the pads, clipped to deep square leg
on off stump, punched to deep point
tossed up outside off, this time he middles the reverse-paddle, down to the right of short third man
full, angling in towards middle stump, clipped round to deep square leg
length ball on middle and leg, clipped down to long-on
nice use of the feet to this flighted ball on off stump, gets close to the pitch of it and flicks over midwicket
now it's Avishka's turn to use his feet and he does even better, skips down the track and away from the line of the ball to loft inside-out over extra-cover, a lovely way to bring up Sri Lanka's 100
flat length ball wide of off stump, reaches out, looking to dab backward of point, fails to connect
full on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
tossed up wide of off stump, lofted over extra-cover and the sweeper has a decent distance to cover to his right to cut it off at the boundary
flat, back of a length outside off, defended back to the bowler
flat one angling down leg, and he picks the line extremely quickly to sweep in the air, between square leg and short fine leg
tossed up on off stump, clipped to long-on
flatter angled into him, bunted to long-on
fuller on the stumps, he gets down on one knee to paddle it around the corner. Short fine leg collects
down the track and gets to the pitch to whip it powerfully but midwicket spills it. Another drop. Catchable height and he didn't have to move too far across, but it bursts through his hands
worked around the corner
shuffles across to clip this to square leg
gave himself room by clearing his front leg to thump this past the bowler but doesn't get the timing right.
reverse swept, but didn't try to force it
comes on the front foot to whip this to deep midwicket
picked this up off his toes. Skips down the track and gets to the pitch to whip it over deep midwicket
pushed to cover
flatter and gets it to bounce a bit more, he goes back and punches it to long-on
fuller into him, flicked off his pads to deep midwicket

and a catch is finally taken. Leask has got a wicket first ball. Floated it up on the stumps, Fernando slog-swept it from down on one knee and the fielder at deep square leg tumbles forward to take the catch
length ball but drifts on the pads and he's easily picked off to deep square
floated up nicely outside off on a fuller length, Mendis gets close to it but pulls his bat out of the way to let it through
length on the stumps, gets behind it and punches to mid-on
beaten loop outside off and goes past the outside edge. Held it's line there and Mendis was playing inside the line expecting it to turn
gets to the pitches of the ball with a stride and pats it back to the bowler
fuller outside off, steps out and whips it to a widish long-on
wihpped to midwicket
fuller ball again on off, turns it with his wrists but can't go past midwicket
waits for this one a bit longer and turns it squarer but still can't get past the fielder
fuller, shuffles across and drives it gently down to long -on
was giving himself some room but it's a tight line on the stumps and Mendis ends up just blocking it back to the bowler
tossed up on the stumps, whips it off his toes to deep midwicket
flatter outside off, slap-driven to long-off
length ball outside off, he backs away to give himself room and glide it off his bat, but can't beat short third man
goes deep in his crease and punches it to deep cover
flatter and shorter, he goes back and punches to long on
tossed up, ends up as a full toss. Unfurls a full-blooded cover drive, but it's straight to the fielder
reverse swept and placed nicely. Picked his shot early, floated up on leg and he paddled it fine past the fielder. Raises fifty
fuller on the stumps and he comes on the front foot to flick it to deep square leg, where the fielder has to run to his left to collect
moves across and clips this length ball past midwicket
tossed up a bit more, he takes a big stride out and pats it to mid-on
length ball, he goes deep in his crease and punches this past a diving mid-on for a single
given some air, ends up a bit too full and is easily flicked to deep midwicket
length ball on the pads, helped on its way to fine leg
drags it a little short and he waits on it to control his pull to deep square leg. Well fielded on the boundary with a diving stop
oooh, that's beaten him. Great carry on that ball, pitched back of a length in the corridor and just kept rising. Mendis's hands followed the ball and he almost edged it behind
short ball again but this time Mendis gets into position early and pulls to deep midwicket
back of length once again, and he swivels to pull but gets it off the bottom half of the bat, as the ball rolls to fine leg

big appeal for caught behind but the umpire is not interested. back of a length outside off and moving away, he follows the ball with his hands again. Was there a noise when it went past the bat? Evans thought so and let out a vociferous appeal, but the umpire didn't think there was anything.
fuller on the stumps, flicked to midwicket, who fumbles but ensures no run
flatter around off, he goes back and punches to midwicket
fuller this time and clipped to wide long-on
that's a delicate looking shot but it's played even as Mendis has lost balance almost. Floated up outside off, he is backing away but adjust to late cut this past the keeper
fuller on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
goes down leg side, Mendis wanted to sweep that hard and fine but misses.
and he nails the sweep this time. Once again down leg side and he sweeps it fine, past short fine leg. Once it beats that man it's always going to be four
back of a length on the stumps, he tucks it to a vacant square leg region
fuller on the stumps, he uses his wrists to twirl it to deep midwicket
length ball on the fourth stump, defended to cover
slower ball, he didn't pick it. Fuller outside off, he wanted to launch into the straight drive but ends up bunting it to mid-on.
back of a length sticking around that off stump line again, but he stays beside the ball and in his crease and runs it down to third man
smacked. Gave himself room and this was on the shorter side so he could swing his arms freely to pull it through midwicket
fuller outside off, he shuffles across and clips it to midwicket
fullish on middle stump, he stays still that time and plays it off the front foot to work it to square leg
nailed. Too full on the pads and he goes down to sweep this powerfully to the fine leg fence
fuller on the stumps, clipped off his toes to long-on
swept to deep square leg
length ball, he skips down the track and pushes it to long-on
shortish on leg stump, gets some extra bounce, misses the flick and is hit on the hip
full, angling across towards off stump, gets on the front foot and clips it away between mid-on and midwicket. Lovely bit of timing
fullish, angling into off stump, clipped away through midwicket
bouncer, angling down leg, it's nowhere near Karunaratne's body but he ducks anyway
gets the line right on the bouncer this time, rises over off stump, and Karunaratne ducks once more
shortish, gets up to stomach height on off stump, drops his bottom hand off the handle and tucks it neatly into the square leg region
length ball outside off, presses forward, lets it come on, and dabs down to third man
tossed up on off stump, clipped to midwicket
drops marginally short on off stump, and that's enough for Mendis, who pounces on the length, rocks back and pulls high over square leg
flat length ball on off stump, clipped to midwicket
another marginally short ball, and Mendis is again on the back foot in the flash, swivels through the hips for a pull to the right of midwicket
similar length, a touch further outside off, short-arm jab along the ground to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, lets it come on, almost lets it pass him, and then taps it on top of its bounce to steer to the left of third man
shot! That's a gentle full ball on off stump, and Mendis extends his arms fully through the drive to launch it waaay over long-on
length ball, fifth-stump line, presses forward and opens his bat face to dab to third man
shortish, fifth-stump line, dabbed down to third man once more
back of a length, angling across to off stump. Stays leg-side of the ball and stabs to backward point

short on off stump, and it's pulled away, more high than long - it seemed to hit higher on the bat than he'd have liked - and it ends up in the hands of the fielder at long-on, who misjudged it a little while running in from the boundary, and ended up having to tumble to his left to take it in the end
back of a length close to off stump, and Mendis whips out his favourite dab to third man

gone first ball! Thisara goes on the attack a little too early! Wheal bowls a shortish ball, angling away from the stumps. Not enough width for the back-foot slash, and he ends up going at it with an angled bat and top-edges to the keeper
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, gets back and across and blocks it back down the pitch, towards the non-striker
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face and dabs to the left of short third man
tossed up on off stump. Gets forward, looking for the clip to long-on, and the bowler moves quickly to his right and dives to intercept
flatter and shorter, blocked to midwicket
flat length ball close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, punched to midwicket
tossed up wider outside off, gets forward but not close enough to the pitch to drive. Uses his wrists to drag it round to midwicket
on the pads, clipped round to deep square leg
short, gets up to shoulder height outside off. Can't control the pull, bounces down well in front of deep square leg
full outside off, driven firmly to mid-off
back of a length close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, fifth-stump line, lets it come on, opens his bat face to dab to short third man
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face to steer to third man
back of a length on off stump, goes back and across and works it through backward square leg
length ball close to off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, punched to midwicket

down the track, and that string of dot balls has created this wicket! Sole had tied Mathews up and he looks for the big release shot, stepping out and looking to hit down the ground. May have wanted to hit it straighter, back over the bowler's head, but he drags his shot round to the fielder at long-on
flat, angling into the pads, clipped through backward square leg
down the track to the flighted ball outside off, whips it away through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, worked away to the right of midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended into the point region
bouncer, angling across and rising shoulder-high over off stump. Well directed, and Thirimanne keeps his eye on the ball and sways away from it

beauty. Lovely fullish length, not quite up there for the drive, and angling away from the left-hander's off stump. Still new to the crease, so his feet aren't moving too well just yet. Aims a drive through the covers and the ball slides past his outside edge
length ball on middle and leg, clipped through midwicket
fullish on middle stump, clipped to the left of mid-on
tossed up on middle stump, driven inside-out to long-off
flat, shortish ball outside off, rocks back for a controlled pull to the man at deep midwicket, brings up a well-paced fifty
dangled up wide of off, goes hard at the angled-bat drive and bottom-edges into the keeper's foot
tossed up full on off stump, driven to deep cover
nicely flighted on off stump, clipped past midwicket, who fumbles after diving left to stop the ball
tossed up slow outside off, driven to long-off
shortish, angling away into a wide-ish line, and Thirimanne slashes and misses
shortish on off stump, lets it come on and dabs it past the right hand of the diving backward point fielder
back of a length on off stump, clipped gently into the vacant midwicket region
back of a length, going across the left-hander, looks to steer to third man and backward point dives right to intercept
back of a length outside off, punched into the cover point region
nicely timed, but again he can't beat the man at backward point. Shortish, close to off stump, and the fielder dives left to stop this straight-bat punch
flattish on a good length, turning into him, and he plays it to square leg
given some more air, skips down the track to drive it gently to long-on
nicely tossed up outside off but a bit too full and he drives through cover point off the front foot
flatter and quicker, but down leg. He wants to paddle it fine but the the extra bit of bounce makes it a top edge. The placement is safe though, very fine
that's out of here. Down the track, gets to the pitch and lifts this well over long on
flatter on the stumps, he stays in his crease and turns it to square leg
full ball on the stumps, he stays very still, uses his wrists to flick it powerfully through midwicket. Great timing on that one

cleaned him up! That's a sight to gladden any bowler's heart. Yorker that tails in late into him, leaves him disbalanced and his stumps all over the place. And he's done it to a man who was looking in prime form. Superb bowling
back of a length outside off, punched to cover
length ball, nipping in a bit, and he pushes forward. It gets a thick inside edge towards square leg
walks across to work through midwicket. Looked like a gentle flick but it's so well timed that it races to the boundary
fuller on the stumps, makes room and drives to deep cover
length ball angling into him, worked to midwicket
flatter angling into him on a length, clipped to midwicket
length ball on off and turning away slightly, punched from the crease, cover tumbles to field
fuller on the pads, he comes on the front foot to work this past square leg
shimmies down the track and pushes this to long-on
flatter and slightly short, he stays back and punches to long-on
length ball on the pads, flicked to fine leg
length ball on the stumps, punched to long-on
nicely bowled, yorker on target and he could only dig it back out to the bowler
loses his line slightly, back of a length but down legside.
good length, angling across him, he waits for it and glides it off an open bat face to third man
fuller length outside off, he waits for it and taps it towards point
fuller on the stumps, steered with a flat bat towards cover point
fuller on the stumps, he comes on the front foot to clip this to long-on
down the track, but he shortened his length and the batsman could only push it to the bowler's right. He dives and saves runs
fuller, driven back past the bowler that time

picks out long-off The pressure of not getting enough big hits has done him in. Was coming down the track and drove with the turn. Didn't time it perfectly and long-off had to only take a few steps to his left to pouch it safely
fuller on the stumps, clipped off his toes to a widish long-on
length ball, flattish, he moves across to clip this off his pads, but short fine leg fields and there's no run
back of a length on the stumps, he stays still and steers it off his chest to third man
punched through cover and he beats the in-field. It's a short enough boundary and the ball finds its way there.
length ball on the stumps, bunted back to towards the bowler. That popped in the air for a bit but fell well short of the bowler
that's a short one that's on target, but Mendis dealt with it well enough eventually. Homing into him between chest and neck, Mendis gets his bat up and half-edges, half-ramps it to third man
good length coming into him, clipped to midwicket

powerfully punched. Got some room outside off and the ball was short enough for him to punch it through a vacant point region. The man at deep cover was running around but puts in a sloppy dive and the ball wins the race to the boundary
flat on a length outside off, stroked to deep point
that's fooled him. Slowly dipping yorker, and gets some drift on it too, ends up on his leg stump and he can't get bat on it, hits him on the toe
flighted too high and ends up as a full toss. He has a whack at it but doesn't time it, to midwicket
in the slot and he nails the slog sweep to perfection. Sends it sailing high and handsome well over deep midwicket and into the trees outside
reverse paddle but short third man is in place so they only get a single
yorker length on leg stump, dug this out to long on
fuller outside off, fetches his flick shot to send it to square leg
flicked straight to deep square leg. Too full and Jeevan got it in the slot on the pads to flick powerfully. Hit it too well in fact but very flat - and it went straight to the man.
greeted with a yorker on off stump, which he digs out to extra cover
short and wide outside off, he wanted to have a thrash at it but doesn't connect. The bowler slipped and fell in his follow through
yorker on middle, he gives himself some room and drives off the toe-end to mid-on
clubbed. Down the track and he pulls this powerfully over midwicket. Back of a length on leg stump but Thirimanne used his forearms to good effect
clobbered. Back of a length coming into him, and Udana gives himself some room and pulls this for six
fuller, driven down the ground very straight.

just over long-off. Wheal's having his figures spoilt in this last over. This was full on the stumps,and he spliced it high going inside out. Wanted to go over extra cover but went over long-on. Valiant effort by Sole to try and pull it back but he doesn't quite manage it
got him this time. Tried to go over the top again, but got it off the end of the bat, and Sole ran in from long-off to dive forward for an excellent catch
stunningly executed. down the track and Wheal went wide of off stump, but Thirimanne paused and almost scooped it over point. Superb timing on that
full outside off, driven firmly but straight to extra cover inside the circle
leading edge goes to cover. Tried to flick this length ball coming into him off his pads, but gets a leading edge that pops up and lands safely close to him, rolls to cover
diving catch dropped at fine leg. He scooped this fine but got more height than distance. Wallace went full length to his left but couldn't hold on
full on the stumps, clubbed to long-off
slower ball goes wrong. Slips out of his hand and is a full toss over the waist - almost over the shoulder in fact. He doesn't connect with it outside off, but it will be a free hit
well bowled, saw him coming down and fired it in at yorker length, and he can only shovel it to short fine leg
demolished. Stays in his crease and swings this full ball outside off waaay over long-on. In the arc, out of the park and all that
strong finish, with a boundary though it is off an inside edge. Wanted to heave it on the legside but it takes the edge and runs past the keeper

inn2.comm: length ball, swinging away in the corridor, left alone
back of a length, straightening towards off stump, rides the bounce and opens his bat face to steer it down to third man
back of a length close to off stump, punched to short cover
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across to defend to short cover
back of a length on middle stump, punched firmly to mid-off
shot. Not particularly short, not a lot of width, but he stands tall and smacks it away on top of the bounce to beat short cover diving to his left
back of a length, swings away in the fourth-stump channel, defends late and close to the body to play it towards backward point
short, wide, Cross slashes and misses thanks to some late outswing
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to fine leg
length ball, swinging from middle to off stump, stays stuck in the crease and jabs at it, looking to punch towards mid-off, gets a thick edge that rolls down to third man
length ball, punched towards mid-on
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length, fifth-stump line, outswing and extra bounce to beat Coetzer's attempt at a punch away from his body
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
shortish, angling into the hips. Looks to flick and misses, the ball clips the hip on its way to the keeper down the leg side

what a ball. Back of a length, pitches on off stump, and pretty much everything he's bowled has swung away from the left-hander. This one nips in off the seam and zips between bat and body as Coetzer plays a hard-hands punch
shot! That's a good-length ball on off stump and he whips it away through the vacant midwicket region
back of a length on off stump, clipped to mid-on
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, clipped gently into the square leg region
length ball on off stump, stays on the back foot to punch to the left of mid-off
strays onto the pads, and he flicks it away to the fine leg boundary
back of a length on off stump and that's an awesome shot, stays leg-side of the ball and punches it away into the big gap between backward point and cover
good ball. Length ball pitching on off stump, nips in with extra bounce to beat the inside edge of his half-forward defensive and hit him on the thigh pad
length ball on off stump, punched to cover
shot! That's a touch too full on off stump, not a half-volley, but full enough for Coetzer to flick it away up and over wide mid-on
short ball, angling in from a little wider on the crease. Cramps him for width on the cut, and extra bounce beats his edge
length ball on off stump, and again he flicks it away, lovely shot over wide mid-on
back of a length outside off, punched towards backward point
back of a length angling down leg. Misses the flick and the ball rolls off his pad into the square leg region
length ball outside off, he lets it through
digs this in short and outside off, he saw it and went for the pull but missed it. More pace on that
swivel-pull to deep square. Shot of a man in form. Back of a length climbing on to his hips, and he pulls it powerfully to the fence
punched to cover
back of a length on the stumps, whipped to midwicket
smashed. Full ball outside off and he drives through the line and goes aerial. Over cover and into the fence
back of a length on the stumps, punched to mid-off
length ball on off stump, stays on the back foot to punch to midwicket
full on leg stump, clipped away to deep square leg
full on middle stump, whipped powerfully but straight to midwicket
tossed up a bit slower on off stump, clipped past the diving midwicket fielder, down to long-on
full on off stump, driven to extra-cover
once again it's pitched right up on off stump, denying elevation to the batsman, driven back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, whipped to midwicket. Was looking to punch through cover but the ball didn't quite come on, so he adjusted and rolled his wrists over
short and wide, and that's a really good-looking shot, no real footwork, just frees his arms and slaps it away over cover point
slower ball, fullish on off stump. Looks to clear his front leg and hit over mid-on, plays too early, gets a thick inside edge into his front pad
length ball close to off stump, takes a big step back into his crease to try and shorten the length, jabs it away to short cover
length ball on leg stump, looks to clip towards mid-on, and midwicket moves quickly to his left to intercept
edged, just beyond the fielder. Looks to sweep from outside off and he doesn't quite get his head over the ball. Top-edges it, and manages to clear short fine leg turning around and chasing back
flat length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
flat again, not short enough to pull and it skids under his bat and hits thigh pad
flat, pitching full on leg stump, too full to sweep, and he misses the sweep and is hit on the pad
a bit of flight for the first time in the over, a touch outside off stump, and he frees his arms and lofts over cover, just aims to clear the fielder rather than hit it too hard
flat length ball on off stump, hoicked away to the man at deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
nowhere near full enough to pull, and it skids through and sneaks under his bat. Doesn't miss off stump by much
shortish, not too much width, slapped to cover point
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
nice-looking shot. Length ball on off stump, punched firmly, with high left elbow, to backward point
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off, and Thisara starts with a maiden
length ball on off stump, defended to cover
back of a length on off stump, punched to deep point
back of a length, a bit of inward movement to cramp up Coetzer. Punched to mid-on

Excellent bouncer, Pradeep makes the breakthrough. Gets up above Coetzer's right shoulder, and he's cramped for room on the hook. Can't control it, and ends up hitting it in the air, down the throat of the man at deep square leg

back of a length on middle stump, and ooh, nearly a run-out! Cross hared out of his crease after clipping to the right of midwicket, and Macleod sent him back. The fielder rushed in quickly, picked up and threw at the keeper's end, and the returning Cross would have been short of his crease had his throw hit
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
fuller one, stump to stump, jabbed back to the bowler's left
back of a length, but keeps it around that off stump line, defended from the crease back towards the bowler
first runs off Thisara after eight dots to start with. length ball on the stumps chopped down to short third man
good length outside off, punched to point
back of a length, rises up nicely and gets the splice of the bat as he attempts to punch this into the offside
back of a length around off again, and he's forcing the batsman to play that one shot in that one area - a punch to point

castled him That's pitched on off and jagged back in sharply. MacLeod was looking to drive on the up but the movement meant the ball snaked through the gap between bat and pad and clipped the leg bail off
good length outside off, steered nicely but point intercepts, diving smartly
fuller on middle and leg, he moves across and flicks it through midwicket
bouncer outside off, he fetches the pull from there but doesn't try to hit it too hard and controls the shot well to get a single to deep square leg
back of a length coming into him from outside off, pushed towards point. They think about a single but decide against it
fuller on off, pushed firmly past cover, who dives to his left and gets a finger on it, but can't stop the run
length ball outside, slashed to third man
short ball, rising up to his chest but a tad slower, he mis-times his pull to square leg
length ball outside off, punched off the front foot, but cover fields
short ball outside off, he goes for the pull, gets a thick top edge that deep midwicket collects on the bounce
back of a length, punched off the backfoot to deep cover
length ball outside off, steered past point, who can't get hands to it despite putting in a dive to his right
fuller on the stumps, turned towards square leg
slower bouncer well outside off, doesn't rise much and doesn't come on at the pace Cross was expecting. He's too early into the pull and ends up missing it altogether
puts more effort into that bouncer but that sails over the batsman's head and will be a wide
good length outside off and moving away a touch, beats his intended drive
goes wide of the crease and bowls another bouncer, better targetted that time and Cross ducks under it
angled into him from wide of the crease and he clips it towards mid-on
fuller on the pads, and worked around the corner
back of a length, pulled to deep midwicket
length ball on off stump, punched to deep point
hint of shape away from the batsman but a bit too full which allows him to slap this through cover
good length, stump to stump, he comes on the front foot for a solid forward defensive
just out of reach of a diving point. Back of a length outside off and he slashed this in the air. Point dove to his right but it was just out of reach
crisply driven through extra cover off the front foot
short ball outside off from around the wicket. He wanted to pull this down but doesn't connect
quicker, skidded onto him a bit and he gets his bat down in time to jab it back to the bowler
powerfully pulled but there is cover in the deep. Short ball outside off and he got in position early to make good connection
fuller outside off, and he square drives it to deep cover
good length homing into him and he gets right behind it to defend with a straight bat
length ball on off again, and he gets into a bit of a tangle, falling over while pushing this into the onside
good length on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler's right
length ball outside off, he gets a nice big stride out to drive through cover
good length, sticking to that teasing off stump line. The batsman wanted to punch it down the ground but gets it off the inside half of the bat and it trickles back to the bowler
good work by Udana at the third man boundary. back of a length outside off and he guides it with the angle to third man, where a diving stop saves the boundary
shot. Given room outside off and he cuts it to point's left for a much needed boundary
length ball on off, punched to mid-off's left with the full face of the bat
comes forward to drives this crisply through extra cover
slower yorker on leg stump, he waits for it and twirls it to midwicket with his wrists
quicker one angling into him from around the stumps and he squirts it towards point
full outside off, driven firmly off the front foot to deep cover
full on the pads, and clipped nicely but can't find the gap and midwicket fields
fuller on middle, on-driven to mid-on's right. Didn't time it all that well
given some air, drifting into the stumps and turning into him, punched to long-on with a straight bat
flatter and shorter, he goes back in his crease and hits this to long-on with a horizontal bat
tossed up more and fuller, driven from the toes but straight to mid-on
length ball spinning into him from outside off, he goes back and cuts this past the in-field
quicker one, he jams this back to the bowler
length ball, he comes on the front foot to drive to long-on
back of a length, angling into off stump, punched to the left of mid-on
length ball angling into the stumps. Looks to flick into the leg side, plays too early and sends the leading edge rolling towards third man
fullish on off stump, driven to the right of extra-cover, who makes a diving half-stop, sending the ball rolling towards mid-off
angles this into Cross' legs, and he works it away to the left of fine leg

gone! Length ball close to off stump, and he's played it with half a bat, opening his bat face to try and run it down to third man. The cutter from Udana, straightens off the pitch, and Wallace only manages an edge through to the keeper
short, nips into Munsey from outside off, punches with an open face towards backward point
tossed up on off stump, driven with the turn to long-on
gets on the front foot to defend this nicely flighted ball outside off. Drifts in, continues along with the angle, and hits the inside half of the bat
another one drifts in towards off stump, and this time Munsey gets down low and sweeps it away to the right of short fine leg

four more. This time it's the reverse-sweep. The line is a little wider outside off, perhaps influenced by the previous shot, and Munsey is quick with his hands and feet to send that rattling away to the right of short third man
length ball, goes on with the angle and seems to be drifting down leg. Looks to flick and misses. Only a feeble lbw appeal
flat and on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, looks to slash it through point, gets a thick edge down to third man
full, angling into off stump, driven past the bowler and mid-off moves to his left to stop it
length ball on off stump, punched to the sweeper at deep cover
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off
low full-toss wide of off stump, and Munsey misses out with his drive. Can't beat the extra-cover fielder diving to his right
back of a length, nips in towards off stump, defended to extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, goes back and across to work through midwicket
looks to sweep and misses, and Dhananjaya goes up in appeal. Not given. Was struck well outside the line of off stump, on the base of the pad on the full
tossed up on off stump, Munsey immediately brings out the reverse-sweep again. In the air, but in the gap between backward point and short third man
another sweep, dangerous as he's playing it from the line of the stumps. Gets a thick bottom edge to short fine leg
length ball sliding onto the pads, clipped to deep square leg
tossed up, spins from off to middle, driven back to the bowler
ooh, nearly. Yorker, angling in and pitching on around leg stump. Munsey is late jamming his bat down in defence, and the ball sneaks past leg stump
short, angling into off stump. Stops on the pitch a little and Cross can't time his pull too well. Rolls away towards deep midwicket
short cutter, jags in off the pitch towards off stump at chest height. Plays late and chops it down to third man
shot. Full on off stump and he whips it away over the non-striker's head, down to the left of long-on
makes a lot of room and Udana bowls the blockhole ball on off stump. Can't squeeze the drive past extra-cover
length ball on off stump, makes room again, flat-bats to mid-off
short, angling into off stump, pulled to deep square leg
length ball on off stump, pushed down the ground towards mid-off
bouncer, angling in towards Munsey's back shoulder. Well directed, and he top-edges the attempted hook, but it eludes both keeper and short third man
short, angling into Cross' left ribcage. Pulled round to long leg
in the blockhole on middle stump. Makes room and jabs towards mid-off
short, angling down leg, and Cross swivels and brings up his fifty with a nicely controlled short-arm pull through backward square leg
full, angling into off stump, driven to mid-off
fullish, wide of off stump, stretches out and slaps to the left of backward point, not quite off the middle of the bat

another top-edged hook, another ballooning ball eludes the fielders. Another perfectly directed bouncer, right at Cross's head, and he top-edges it in the direction of where short fine leg would be. Fine leg is on the boundary, however, and it's keeper Mendis who has to chase it. Almost gets there with a despairing dive, but not quite
full on off stump, clipped to the left of straight midwicket
shortish, angling into the hip, can't connect with the flick and gets a leg bye into the square leg region
in the blockhole on off stump, makes room and eases it to deep point
short and swatted over long-on
short outside off, flat-batted to long on
length outside off, driven uppishly but falls short of mid-off
swung to the square leg boundary. Too full and on the pads, flicked powerfully off his toes

find the long-on fence now. Munsey is having a go at this target! Makes as if to give himself room then moves across and Thisara delivers a low full toss outside off. It's in perfect hitting arc and he has a golf swing at it, sends it crashing into the long-on fence despite the best efforts of the fielder running to his left
loses his radar and goes very far outside off
full outside off and drilled back past the bowler. They sprint between the wickets to get two
good length on the stumps, bunted to long-off
was moving away to give himself room but Lakmal follows him and it rolls off his pads to short fine leg
swing and a miss. Stays in his crease and wants to whack this over cow corner but it's on a length outside off, and he doesn't make contact even
caught at long-off. Got more height on it than distance. Very fulland he was giving himself room to go straight, but got the toe-end and it swirled to long-off, who made no mistake
backing away again and Lakmal follows him again. Clipped off his toes to deep midwicket
and he nails a flat-batted swipe over long-off for six. Full outside off, he was giving himself room and swung it hard
very full outside off, carved away to deep point
slower ball angling away from off stump, swings hard at it and only manages to drag it through backward square leg off the inside half of the bat
in the blockhole outside off, picked the line early and went for the reverse-sweep, but couldn't connect
back of a length, fairly wide of off stump. Looks to plant his front foot forward and slap that over cover, and the ball whizzes past his outside edge
another play and miss. This time he walks across his stumps and targets the fine-leg area with the scoop. The line is again wide of off stump, and he fails to make contact
wham. Udana shifts his line, goes full and angling into off stump, and Munsey stands still, clears his front leg, and launches it cleanly over the bowler's head

full outside off, slower ball. Slices the big hit over mid-off, doesn't middle it at all. The fielder turns around and runs towards the boundary to try and catch it, and can't get there. The batsmen think of a second run, but Munsey slips a little while completing the first, and they decide against it
whangs the bouncer down the leg side, and he misses his hook. Mendis can't collect cleanly, moving to his right, and they pick up another run
full outside off, goes for the big hit, tries to take on long-off, and can't clear the fielder. Avishka Fernando moves a few steps to his left and takes it well
again he slips one down the leg side, looking to cramp Munsey up. Slogs and misses
length ball, angling into the stumps, and Munsey clears his front leg and hoicks it high over wide long-on to bring up a 37-ball fifty
in the blockhole, right at Munsey's feet. Digs it out and clips it down the ground towards long-on. Rolls fairly slowly an the man has to come in off the rope, so they can run a quick two

makes a lot of room and goes deep in his crease as well. Lakmal does very well to follow him with the yorker at the feet. Looks to whip it over the leg side but can only get an inside edge into his pads. Rolls away a short distance into the off-side half of the pitch
what a way to get off the mark! Length ball angling into off stump, and he shuffles across and scoops it over his shoulder and over the keeper's head

wow, he's really rattled Sri Lanka here. Jumps deep in his crease to the attempted leg-stump yorker, and he ends up creating the leverage to whip it round to the backward square leg boundary. Top shot
ooh, nearly takes out off stump. Up in the blockhole again, and Munsey makes room and misses the big hit over the covers

gone, he's found a way through. Again he clears his front leg and looks to go inside-out, over the covers. This ball, however, is too full for that, and angling too far in to give him any room. Past the inside edge of his angled bat, and into middle stump
another yorker, another wicket. Right up at the base of middle and leg stumps, and he makes room to jab through the off side and misses
in the blockhole again, angling into off stump, jabbed away into the covers
sees Sole looking to make room and nails the yorker on leg stump. Jams his bat down and squeezes it down the ground into the mid-on region
slower length ball on off stump. Makes room and tries to go over mid-off. Ends up slicing it instead, high in the air to the fielder at extra-cover
full on middle and leg. Looks to slog over mid-on and drags it through backward square leg off the inside half of his bat
length ball outside off. Clears his front leg, slogs, misses
bangs it in short on off stump. Looks to open up and pull, the ball hits high on his bat and pops up and plops down in the midwicket area
shot. Walks right across and flicks the full one on off stump over the man at short fine leg
leg-stump yorker. Makes a bit of room and jabs into the covers

Down the track, can't get close enough to the pitch, swings hard but can only send it to long-off on the bounce. Looks to keep strike even when two runs were out of the question, and poor Alasdair Evans is run out by yards at the danger end
down the track, shortens his length a little and he slaps to extra-cover. And what's happened here? They've looked to run a single and there's been a run-out. And that is that for Scotland
